docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 -- The Senate Finance Committee was told to day that $415,000 in commissions was paid to Juan Leguia, son of Augusto Leguia, former President of Peru for acting as agent in three loans to Peru totaling $100,000,000.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 -- The Senate Finance Committee was told to day that $415,000 in commissions was paid to Juan Leguia, son of Augusto Leguia, former President of Peru for acting as agent in three loans to Peru totaling $100,000,000.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 8. -- The diplomatic tension between Argentina and Uruguay appears to be lessening rapidly and the belief is growing that the incident of the Entre Rios revolt will be settled in a manner satisfactory to both countries.

docs.snippet: There has just been completed a survey of a movement, begun forty years ago, that now touches most of the countries of the earth. It may be called an "adventure," since those who have carried its gospel and service have been for the most part...
docs.lead_paragraph: There has just been completed a survey of a movement, begun forty years ago, that now touches most of the countries of the earth. It may be called an "adventure," since those who have carried its gospel and service have been for the most part possessed by the spirit of pioneers making experiment in new and strange fields.

docs.snippet: Domestic corporation bonds were buoyant on the Stock Exchange yesterday with a long list of issues furthering their improvement of last week by a point or more. Foreign loans, however, were irregularly lower, and United States Government bonds were...
docs.lead_paragraph: Domestic corporation bonds were buoyant on the Stock Exchange yesterday with a long list of issues furthering their improvement of last week by a point or more. Foreign loans, however, were irregularly lower, and United States Government bonds were weak.

headline.main: RAILS AGAIN LEAD RISE IN HOME BONDS; Corporation Issues Buoyant on Stock Exchange -- Federal Section Weak. FOREIGN LOANS DECLINE German, French and British Groups Lose Ground -- Day's Turnover Exceeds $15,000,000.

docs.snippet: The bond market on the Stock Exchange showed considerable irregularity yesterday, with trading slightly heavier than on the previous day, approximating $15,500,000. Measured by the averages on high-grade domestic corporation and foreign loans, the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The bond market on the Stock Exchange showed considerable irregularity yesterday, with trading slightly heavier than on the previous day, approximating $15,500,000. Measured by the averages on high-grade domestic corporation and foreign loans, the market wag only slightly lower for the day.

headline.main: DEALINGS HEAVY IN FEDERAL BONDS; List on Stock Exchange Drops Below 1931 Lows, but Some Rally Moderately. RAILROAD GROUP ACTIVE Gains and Losses Fairly Well Balanced -- Foreign Loans Fluctuate Narrowly.
